Title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
Author: Brian Helgeland

Replies.Reply: Come on... I'll take good care of you. All the bugs you can eat.
You're gonna scare him away.
Your problem, Steve, not mine...
Forget it. The ball.
A freak show. Ever been to one?
Must be a different one.
I don't get it.
Right. You're failing half your classes at school, but you're studying vampires.
What? When?
That's your proof? It smells.
Come on.
What was his name? Mr. Dracula?
Saw your shadow on the floor.
Get me one, too.
Huh? Tonight where?
I got no money right now.
That place is supposed to be haunted.
What am I going to tell my parents?
I don't know, man...
Mom? I'm gonna sleep over Steve's tonight? Okay?
What? Why not?
I'm fourteen. I shouldn't even have to ask stuff like this.
I've known him since I was five years old!
But -- That's not fair!
You know why they closed it, right?
The balcony. Where he fell...
He knew my name.
He's as old as us.
It's him...
Reacts. A spider!
Let's get outta here.
Wait. What're you doing?
Told by who? The guy in the chat room? The internet guy?
Steve...
Steve...?
Coming down the creaky stairs. Spooky.
Steve...
Stops short as a LIGHT suddenly cuts through the gloom to his left. Darren steps over low behind a CREDENZA. He sees...
Reacts as MADAM OCTA tries to jump on his face! The bars of her CAGE stop her. It rests on the credenza he crouches behind. The whistle is there too. Darren looks over as...
Rooted to the spot. Watching...
Moving slightly to get a clearer view.

Can't believe what he's watching. He sees Crepsley suddenly get 'scent' of something. Something to do with Steve's blood. Not quite a clear view as Crepsley grabs Steve's wrist, dabs a finger into his palm and then tastes it.
Frozen to his spot, watches as Crepsley, seemingly ill, holds his head and spits again onto the floor. Then he steps over and kicks the fridge door closed.
Oh. You want that?
See? I'm your friend... You're so beautiful I stopped thinking.
It was down at the old Zeiterion Theater. Look, dad, I'm sorry.
Yeah? So?
Steve had money.
He wouldn't do that.
Man, what is this? You don't want me hanging around with him. Now you say you think he stole money?
Steve's had some bad times lately.
I have to sneak out! You treat me like a kid!
It wasn't like that.
Annie, you gotta learn to knock.
Out.
Mom, this is the best omelette I ever had.
What happened last night?
Don't worry. There's, you know, no bad blood or anything like that.
I said don't worry.
What are you, the word police?
Wanna see that new game I got?
Let me see that --
I took it at the show.
They were loading a van outside.
Just because he had a coffin doesn't mean he's really a...
I didn't believe it.
I heard what you said to him, too.
I wish I knew how to play it.
You mean telepathy?
I swear to God, Annie...
Don't move.
Steve...
Get dad. Go.
I think some kind of a tarantula.
It got away.
Hello?
Crosses don't hurt you?
Because... you're evil.
That's different. Bats are animals.
Your spider bit my friend Steve.
He's dying.
You have to help him!
I'll pay you back. If it takes 50 years. Whatever it costs.
There's something you want. That's why you're here waiting for me.
He wanted to... become like you.
I think so...
I don't believe that someone can have bad blood.
Me?
You're crazy. There's no way.
Destiny? That doesn't make sense.
Not for me.
There's gotta be another way.
Please... He's my friend.
You'd never be able to trust me.
How'd we get here?
What's happening?
He's my friend.
Never met him. I don't think Steve ever did either. Why do you want to know?
What?
Don't ever do that again.
Yeah?
It's cruel.
I killed it.
Tell me about it later.
I said later.
Got you something.
No it's not. King's my buddy.
Come on.
The usual. Sometimes it was boring, sometimes really boring.
Standing at the blood's seeming siren call. But as he suddenly moves forward, she turns away.
You're different...
Hello? Hey!
I'm starting to think it's me that's scary.
It's only gonna get worse, isn't it? There's no way back, is there?
We made a deal. I won't run away again.
I can't just -- My family, I can't let them think I just left them.
What?
I'm going to bed.
I love you both. I don't say it that much, but I do.
Good night.
Goodbye, knucklehead. If I can ever help you, I will.
Shut up.
This is my home and I'm never gonna see it again, so don't rush me.
Hold onto this for me, okay?
You're sure it will work?
What if I break bones?
And the funeral home? Won't they embalm me or something?
My dad's allergic to grass. It's my job to cut the lawn.
So this is destiny, huh? Tastes like crap.
My legs are asleep.
What are you doing here?
What do you have against vampires?
Are you crazy? I did it to save your life. That was the deal. Me for you.
I want you to leave...
I want you to leave and forget you ever saw me. Understand?
Would a stake through the heart kill a vampire?
Before what's over?
Let's go.
How's that? Dark enough?
Better.
It's sunrise.
Maybe I'll wait until noon and then open every door and curtain in the place.
Minnesota...
I don't understand.
Where do you keep your car anyhow?
The one you were driving around my town in. The old black one.
It was near school one day. It followed me home a few days later.
I couldn't see who was driving.
What?
Go. Run.
Did you kill her?
Will she become a vampire?
Don't take too much.
What others?
No. I won't.
I'll never do it.
I'm only half-vampire.
I'll die first.
What is it?
Something out there scares you.
The blood... I wanted it. I wanted to drink it.
Thank you.
The car...
Where'd you hear that?
Who is?
See what?
It's behind us!
Who were they? Vampires?
How dangerous can a man named Mr.
Then what is he?
And the purple guy. What was he?
Yeah? Keep talking.
But some didn't?
What? That's crazy.
Oh yeah... This is so much better than where I used to be...
Half vampire.
I liked it better where I was.
Do you eat mice?
I caught your act in the last town.
Snakes can catch cold?
Who are they all?
How did they end up here?
Oh, I'm Darren.
I snuck out to see it once, too.
You have no idea...
How long have you known Mr. Tall?
How do you meet someone like him?
Almost done.
I just felt sick for a second.
You think Mr. Tiny might come?
Who is he? What does he want?
Can't you give me a straight answer just once?!
No. I never thought about it.
I'm not a child.
I'm in between.
You guys are friends?
Like roommates? To save money?
Who was hunting you?
He tried to kill us.
What are you guys talking about!?
I won't drink blood if that's what you mean. I promised myself.
You'll get insulted.
I'm afraid if I drink blood, I'll become evil.
That's how it would start. I would swear it was just to stay alive.
Why did Crepsley make himself an exile anyhow?
With the vampaneze?
You've known him a long time?
Why'd he choose you?
Is it why he chose me?
The vampaneze? Mr. Tiny?
Lucky for me. Glad I could help.
That part is definitely cool.
Nothing.
Don't know. I'm congested.
Hey...
Must've been a long time ago.
No. No parents.
You have to be different to be here.
He's a snake-boy.
I get scared easy.
How'd you get up there anyhow?
You're crazy!
I got nothing to prove.
Why's that?
What's that?
Is Sam your boyfriend?
Oh...
We should get off this.
Chalk it up to lack of blood, but everything starts spinning.
It's okay. I'm okay.
You wouldn't have fallen in the first place... I just got dizzy.
She's kind'of cool, huh? I mean, for a girl.
She's just curious.
What makes you such an expert?
What's good about it?
He stops as Sam and Debbie catch up with him.
You guys are coming to the show again tonight?
Oh, you came to see Evra.
Hey, I'll catch up with you later.
I'm fine.
No! I won't let you hunt some poor person down for me. I --
No. I can't. I'm human.
I am human. In my heart I am.
This way.
I don't think so.
He said you can't be explained.
You've chosen the vampaneze.
Terrible profits.
What prophesy?
I think you're a creep. I think you suck.
Forget about her --
You guys are in trouble. There's more than one vampire now. Gavner Purl is here.
Crepsley! Look out!
Concentrating. Trying to flit.
He doesn't care about me.
Steve?
Is that who you talked to? Was that the internet guy? Mr. Tiny?
Has lost sight of them, he can only hear the battle now. He reacts as Evra, Debbie and Sam rush out. Evra takes hold, lifts, tries to lessen the load on the chain.
Are you guys nuts? Get outta here!
Evra. I think I'm dying.
Oh Sam. Oh no...
Forgive me, Sam, but I need strength. I need blood.
We're going to save her together.
FORGIVE ME!!!
Let her go.
Shut up, Steve.
It's over, Steve.
Liar.
Did you steal money from my mom's purse?
Did you?
No. It's just practically the last thing that ever happened between me and my dad was I was arguing with him.
I was telling him he was wrong about you. That's the last time we had together. Fighting about you.
I miss him.
Do you understand?
I miss him so much.
No. He used to be my friend.
Start running. Don't ever stop.
Are you gonna be okay?
You think I made a mistake, don't you?
Half human. What now?
There's a war on, isn't there?
This world is crossed by fences.
It's not gray. I've met the bad guys. They need to be stopped.
But you said it. There's no in between. And the power of being alone is never going to be greater than the weakness. It's our fight.
He was a good kid. It's weird, but I remember things about him even though I wasn't there when they happened. Even though it's impossible.
He didn't die in vain.
You never know.
Hope is a good word. I hope so, too.
Where are we going?
So what are we waiting for? Let's go.
Hey, Darren!
Did you fall in? Darren!
Man, we're getting killed out there. It's three to nothing.
GOAL! Three to one!
Three to two!
What does that prove? Huh?
That's why he kicked it. To kill time. Well, I still got time to kick your face.
You idiot!
Look at this.
.Human oddities and other living curiosities...
Other. Does that mean not human?
Just this school.
I gotta show you something...
Vampires. I've been studying them.
They been around 1000's of years.
Okay, sometimes, when humans fight?
Some people know about it. There have even been books written.
It's everywhere if you look. On the internet, in blogs, newspapers, weird places. But you can find it.
I chatted online with one of them.
Serious.
I'm gonna get a soda.
Sorry, Mrs. Shan.
I wish I was.
She's okay... She's been working a lot lately.
I know.
I gotta go. See ya tonight.
Cirque du Freak.
Don't sweat it. I got money. Meet me ten to Midnight. The Zeiterion Theater.
Tell them you're sleeping over. We can meet early, walk over together.
D, it's Cirque du Freak. You wanna hear about it Monday? Or see it tonight?
I came here after your house.
Get inside.
We're here to see the show.
Maybe he heard me say it.
No, you go. I'm staying.
This is my destiny. Don't ruin it.
That car today. It was a sign.
I'll tell you later. If I can.
Turning a corner, is startled by what turns out to be a costume mannequin. But beyond: a LONG BOX set on two sawhorses. Coffin-sized. Empty, its lid propped up by it.
He's opened the door to the fridge. The little bulb inside pushes through the gloom, lighting the area up.
Reaches in the fridge, takes out a glass jar that looks to be filled with BLOOD. Steve raises it, swirls it around inside.
I -- I know who you are.
You're a vampire.
Nothing. No one.
I want to join you.
I want you to make me a vampire.
I don't care about living forever.
I already do.
My father's gone; my mother doesn't care about me.
I have a friend, but he doesn't understand. He's got too much to know what it's like to be alone.
When you're alone you feel weak.
I don't care.
Do it. Make me a vampire.
What's wrong?
What do you mean?
That's a lie. You take that back!
Hey, midget, where's the idiot?
Hi, Mr. Shan, Mrs. Shan. It's nice to see ya.
What was that? Everyone acting like they don't know me. Did I walk in on something?
Nothing. I hung out in the theater for awhile, but no one was around.
Sorry about the way I acted. I'm sorry I pushed you.
What?
You said bad blood. I never heard you say something like that before.
Sure...
I gotta get one of these.
It's Madam Octa.
Liar. Look at the background.
How'd you do it?
Just like that...
You stole from a vampire you know?
You were there, weren't you?
You heard what he said to me? That I was evil?
How do you think he made her do what he wanted?
I think that was just for show. I think he used something else. Some kind of mind control.
I bet anyone with a brain could do it. Which leaves you out.
Darren?
.Doctor said it was a miracle.
Hey, Darren. I've been looking for you. We got a lot to talk about.
But first...
Welcome to Cirque du Steve. What happens to us all can happen to any of us. If you watch, it's by your own free will. Say farewell...
It's nature. Anyhow don't watch.
And don't blink; you might miss it.
What happened to the spider?
I had a dream. You and Crepsley were in my hospital room...
I'll tell you now.
Vampire hunting.
Yeah, I wanted to, but you did.
Liar. You told him I was evil.
I'm going to hunt you, Darren. You and the other one. Crepsley. I'll put a stake in you and burn you to ashes. I'll make sure you never come back from the grave again.
Mr. Tiny made my dream come true.
Pretty funny, huh? He introduced himself after you left town.
But, I think I've known him a long time in my head. In my bad, bad blood.
He gave me back the dream you stole.
Ooops...
He's more surprised than shocked. Until the wolfman looks his way. Then he heads for the hills, disappears into the dark. The wolfman turns back toward Debbie.
Is Crepsley dead?
What can I do?
Stop being a big shot. This isn't like stopping some fight at school.
Stay back! Or I'll throw her off!
Is it?
You wanna hear something funny?
And they were fine. They acted like they barely remembered you.
And your sister. She was moving into your room. They had a yard sale. I bought some of your stuff.
What?
Why do you ask? Is knowing that gonna help you rest in peace?
Least you had a dad to argue with.
Hate to tell ya. Your dad was right. How do you think we got the money for the dumb tickets? I took it. Just like I'm gonna take you.
Next time...
Thanks, Darren. He's crazy.
For the next life, Shan. Top right corner every time.
Probing the confines of its glass prison. A BOA CONSTRICTOR by any other name. It's a prison within a prison because we're inside...
How'd you know?
And that's why we need a dog.
How do you guys decide who's going to say no when you look at each other.
Is he in a lot of trouble?
I don't see what the big deal is...
Where was she?
Mom said to come eat. What's that?
What? I knocked.
Darren, he's freezing.
Boo!
Got you! I finally got you! -
Darren! Wait up!
Can I walk home with you?
He's adorable.
Hey. That's King.
That's King, Darren. It is.
I know you want to fight global warming, Darren, but that's not the way to do it.
Oh hi, Steve. I thought you were, Darren.
Help yourself.
How's your mother?
Glasses are up there.
Hello?
No.
Because I said so, Darren.
The answer is no. And I'm not sure I want you hanging around with Steve anymore.
People change and I don't like the way Steve's changing.
Get this. She said she couldn't comment because she didn't make it home last night herself.
Go tell Darren it's breakfast.
Darren... Wake up, honey.
I just got off the phone. Great news. Steve's going to be okay.
The hospital says it's a miracle.
Yeah, it's great news. I know how you feel.
How was school today?
Ouch!
It's okay, honey. I just need a band-aid.
We love you, too. Don't we, Tommy?
Darren! Oh my God!
We'll have to think about it.
Whoever's eyes are the widest. And I didn't say no. Yet.
Stop arguing with her, Darren.
Get inside.
A freak show? Are you kidding me?
You told me the other day you were broke. You were looking for a job to do around the house this weekend.
Where'd you get money for the show?
Steve... We weren't going to tell you, but we think Steve stole money from your Mom's purse yesterday.
Mom's pretty sure about it.
No.
Being a good friend and sneaking out are two different things.
Then act like an adult if that's how you want to be treated. This world is crossed by fences --
A freak show. What do they do, put people in cages for everyone to laugh at?
Nothing a few years in prison won't take care of.
Did you talk to Steve's mom yet?
We have a picture of it.
If my son said he took that photo, then that's the truth.
Of course we do.
Kids. Who knows how they think?
Darren? Darren!
I love you, Darren. You said it the other night; I didn't say it back.
They move toward a light at the end. Darren pauses at a darkened staircase. Headed up. He points it out to Steve...
May I help you?
And old vampires?
We'll call it a draw then.
An usher in the house of usher.
When they turn it, Mr. Tall is gone. Vanished. Ahead, a threadbare velvet CURTAIN. A low murmur on the other side.
My name is Rhamus Twobellies. And I do have two.

Evra starts to make a HISSING sound. In response, the snake begins corkscrewing around him like the stripes on a barber shop pole. Finally, it slithers around his neck, pulls back to look him in the eye. And then...
Crepsley disappears! The crowd mumble nervously. And just as suddenly he's back! On the edge of the stage, lit by the footlights. This time he holds a draped BIRDCAGE.
Crepsley makes the introduction.
Madam Octa has nearly reached Crepsley's left shoulder.
Darren sees Debbie who gives a little wave. As he smiles...
As Murlough 'appears' alongside Crepsley.
CHEERS as Murlough charges forward, the long knives pinwheeling in his hands. His attack is brutal and blunt.
Murlough swings back wildly. Crepsley catches the blade in Murlough's left hand with the one in his right.
Murlough rolls to his feet, charges. It's brute force versus style. But as Crepsley moves to sidestep, Murlough's not so brutish after all. He matches the move --
Darren reappears, leaps onto Murlough's back, knocks him off target. As Murlough staggers right, Crepsley staggers left.
It's not true. That all tarantulas are poisonous. Though some can kill a man. With one bite.
Her name? Madam Octa. Pray that she never learns yours.
No...? Shall it be life?
I wonder if you would be as shocked to see the same fate for me?
Though we have been together such a long time, she is no pet. I think she would quite enjoy killing me.
For her bite there is no cure.
Tell me, boy. Who am I?
Too broad a definition. Do you introduce yourself as a human? Who I am is Larten Crepsley.
Who sent you and what do they want?
Then what do you want?
Join me? I don't understand.
Is it because you want to live forever? Because we don't.
A long time alone. Do you want to live alone?
Are you an orphan?
Nor mine. You're friendless also?
The power of being alone will never be greater than the weakness of it.
It makes no matter. We do not blood children. I'm sorry.
Do you intend to use that on me?
Do not tempt me.
Crepsley shoves Steve down to the ground and immediately begins spitting onto the floor. Like it was poison.
You have bad blood.
I can taste the menace in your blood. You can never be a vampire.
Go home.
GO!
What have you come for this time?
Why should they?
Am I? Are vampire bats evil when they drink the blood of cows?
So am I. So are you. Our appetites don't make us evil.
Why are you here?
Yes, well, boys who play with things they do not understand can hardly complain if --
The antidote to her poison is rare.
Money doesn't interest me.
The night Steve came below to speak to me, you were there. Did you hear what we talked about?
You don't just 'become' a vampire.
But your friend has bad blood.
And yesterday you didn't believe in vampires. Regardless, I've left the Cirque. Left my protection. I need someone to protect me while I sleep. I need an apprentice.
Then your friend will die.
You hardly have a choice. It's your destiny.
Try this then. You're reckless enough to steal, responsible enough to come back for a friend. That's enough for me.
Yes, well, destiny can't be explained. It must be lived. Now, you're wasting my time.
There isn't.
And he slips away while we argue.
Yes or no?
You have good blood.
Lift your hands.
Get used to pain. More lies ahead.
The blood flows into your left arm and out of your right. Do you feel it? Getting near your heart?
Almost there.
The world will start to slow down.
Take my arm. Don't let go.
Lick your fingers. Vampire spit will stop wounds from bleeding.
It's called flitting. Which room is your friend in?
We're in time. He still has a few minutes left.
He was near death. The journey back is not pleasant. What do you know about him, this boy with bad blood?
Hmm... Who's his father?
Will you come with me now or do you have things to set in order first?
I see...
Run if you want. It won't help.
The darkness isn't so scary anymore, is it?
It's neither here nor there, but, I do feel sorry for you.
Are you ready then? The night is young. We can make many miles.
There's only one thing for it.
We'll have to kill you.
Your heart will slow down so drastically they won't find a pulse. With the fall from the window, they'll think you're dead.
Even better. They'll mend in a few days. Vampires don't stay broken for long and it takes a very long fall to kill one.
Don't worry. I have ways of making my thoughts become the thoughts of others. They'll leave you alone.
You have a new job now. Drink.
Your breathing is slowing, your heart as well. Do you feel it?
You may be aware of what's going on around you. Remember, the grief that you hear will be a release for those who express it.
Not on a child.
On your feet.
Walk it off. I'll fill this back in. Go. Breathe some air.
If we ever meet again, I will show you loneliness you cannot imagine.
Do you still question his blood?
Yes. But so would getting hit by a truck if it was going fast enough.
He'll be trouble before it's over.
This adventure we're on. Shall we start?
You'll get used to it after awhile.

Yes, sunlight would kill me. My electrons are different than a human's. But it would take several hours of exposure. I'd have plenty of time to kill you before I closed the curtains and went back to bed.
We can die violently. Accidentally or otherwise. But we also grow old. A full vampire will age one year for every ten human years he's alive. A half-vampire like you: one for every five.
Should we do the math or not?
In Paris. The days of the Terror.
Exactly. You're going to be a teenager for a very long time.
What car?
I've never owned a car, Darren. I don't need one.
And you saw me behind the wheel?
It wasn't me.
There...
Dinner.
I put her to sleep. She'll be like this 15 minutes. When she wakes up, she won't remember a thing.
No. She'd have to share y blood for that to happen.
A vampire who feeds often can control himself. One who drinks only when he must can end up feeding wildly.
The hunger inside us must be fed to be controlled. To be civilized.
Your turn.
Darren...
You can lead a vampire to blood, but you can't make him drink.
No matter, you need blood to live now. You'll drink eventually.
Don't be stupid. You may abstain tonight, but you must feed soon.
Nothing. Let's go.
The thought of spending another minute with you.
We still need to eat food, too. I just don't need it tonight.
Now what?
Of course you did! You're a Crepsley catches himself. He is not without some compassion.
I'm sorry. It was wrong of me to blood you. You're too young. But it's done. Like the entire history of the world up to this moment.
Eat. Let's not waste anymore food tonight.
Almost out of gas. But looking ahead. Clocks in an instant: a RED LIGHT AHEAD. Cars STOPPED. A CAR FROZEN having just crossed the INTERSECTION. HEADLIGHTS from a blind corner.
Find a blanket. A rug. Cover it.
My arm's broken. But it should be fine in a day or two.
No. The one with the watch was Mr.
Who said he was a man?
Mr. Tiny can't be explained. He needs to be experienced.
A vampaneze.
Long ago humans were looked upon as animals by some vampires. Cattle to be slaughtered. Laws were passed to forbid needless killing.

Seventy vampires broke away, declared themselves a separate race. The Vampaneze. Over time their appearance changed, their numbers grew. They believe it's wrong to feed from a human without killing it.
They believe those of us who feed in small amounts live like leeches.
The last one nearly destroyed us all. There's been a truce for many years now.
Will you be alright while I sleep?
What do you think of rejoining the Cirque du Freak? Until you get on your vampire feet so to speak.
Yes, yes. Three-eighths if you want. What do you think?
Do you still have my coffin?
I'd be delighted.
You don't approve?
I'm no longer part of their domain.
How do you feel about show business?
To be poisoned by a spider may be my fate.
Look glum... Miserable...
Darren...
I'm not going to sleep here. We'll find a nook in the factory.
You need blood.
What we want is who we are, don't you think?
You won't learn by me telling you.
Okay. Why do you like spiders?
Did you ever think there was a particular reason?
That's the trouble with children.
Are you a man? If you're not a man, you're a child.
In between does not exist!
I'll sleep in here tonight. But sit outside the van tomorrow and make it look like I'm there. It's just caution. Old habits die hard.
Gavner Purl, as always I heard you coming from a mile away.
Decades now.
Never mind. Darren, Gavner Purl.
Of course. We don't make full vampires of our assistants.
I have my reasons.
All I care to say is a boy sought me out, knew who I was. He asked me to make him my assistant.
It wasn't Darren. Another boy.
I met Darren shortly after. His blood was good or I certainly would have killed him.
He tried to kill me. What he wanted with you wasn't determined.
What's important enough to track down an exile? What is your news?
I'm not interested in your wars.
I've had enough killing! No more!
The sun is coming. Will you stay?
Then travel safely.
Take him with you if you want.
Good morning, Darren.
Look at you. You can barely stand.
You need to feed. You need blood..
No need to hunt. There's someone here willing to save you.
Drink or you'll die.
You're not! And you'll be nothing!
Holding Madam Octa's cage. Aware something's 'in the air'.
Reacting to Murlough's voice.
Listening as the scream fades off. Clutching his stomach, Crepsley moves.
Evra... Get them out of here.
I can smell it. Why does it hide?
The vampire is here.
Even the creatures of the night watch too much TV.
Kill him, Darren. Do it now so you won't have to do it later.
I just need to catch my breath.
No. I think that you proved yourself human after all.
What do you mean?
Yes, yes. Black and white fences crossing very gray fields.
I'm not sure it's my fight.
His blood is in you.
Actually, that's exactly what it does.
Yes. Keep my coffin ready, would you?
To meet the Vampire Generals. War clouds are forming. A storm is coming. And I have a feeling you're needed much more than I am.
Take my arm.
But... What happened to him?!
I know, I know. And you gotta decide which side you stand on.
In her cage, on the desk. Darren and Steve looking her over.
Lands on Steve's shoulder. Her fangs, wet with poison, glint just before she sinks them into Steve's throat. She BITES!
What kind of spider was it?
Where is it?
Anaphylactic shock. Get Doctor Lund. And we need to download a photo to poison control.
Where he stops short, sees in the center of the stage --
Crepsley pulls loose Darren's hand. They're still bleeding.
Hey, Shan, you gotta see this.
TWENTY or so KIDS all pressed around the Boa Constrictor tank. Steve holds court.
.to Crepsley the mouse.
Steve hesitates. Darren pushes to the front.
Annie SCREAMS as a GERMAN SHEPHERD charges, stops just short of them. GROWLING like it was rabid. Like it hates Darren.
No, no, come on --
Hey -- Hey, kid --
Is he dead?
Cause of death is trauma from the impact of the fall. Poor kid.
I'm not going to cut open a kid.
Are we doing an autopsy?
He's still cute.
I always had a crush on him.
A hand reaches down, a thumb opens his eyelid.
I'm sorry. I know it's difficult, but visiting hours are over.
Ashes to ashes, dust to dust, in sure and certain hope of the resurrection to come...
Passing among the graves, stretching his arms, twisting.
Yes?
Darren knows trouble when he sees it. He looks back at Crepsley, but the vampire is gone! Vanished.
Smell the blood. The lovely blood.
Closes regardless, relentless, death in his eyes.
Is it Dar-wren's girlfriend?
She has plenty of lovely blood inside. Inside, outside, hmmm?
I don't care about humans. I don't care about you. But the vampire -
Have you seen Purl Gavner's face?
Shimmers, phases into flit mode. Disappears.
CREPSLEY!
Crepsley will come for his assistant.
Murlough has an assistant, too. A smart one, smarter than you.
Crepsley comes.
The vampire will die.
Let's get readyyyyy to rumble!
Who knows? Young Murlough lives, but he's hurt.
What can Dar-wren's girlfriend do?
You need to stand still so you can die.
Hey, man, are you okay?!
It goes black except for a glint in Crepsley's eyes. He sighs, settles down on the ground. Worn out.
What do you do? Me? I'm a snake boy. I do a whole snake thing.
Big Macs actually.
Thanks. I'm not doing it tonight.
Still gotta work the floor though.
The backbone of Cirque du Freak.
Most wandered in. If Mr. Tall likes them, they stay.
Can we help you find a seat?
Only the best seats in the house.
Oui. Vous etes observateur. Nous sommes les serpents frangais.
Evra Von.
Five years.
I was raised in a circus, but not a nice one like this. The owner used to beat me and keep me in a glass cage. I felt like a useless freak.
What's up?
It's smells like burnt hair.
Let's scare the crap out of him...
What're you doing here?
Off the hook, huh? I'll tell all the freaks you said so.
No school either.
Everyone has a place they belong.
It's okay. I am a snake boy.
Hey, be careful.
Come on, guys...
Thanks for the heads up... Bro.
Well, the food's down on ground level. Let's get out of here.
I like her. She asks a lot of questions though.
There's no such thing as 'just' with a girl.
My snake's a girl.
Reacting as Debbie and Sam arrive. They move toward it.
You guys better go back.
Darren's my friend.
Sam, unhook his legs.
It's against our code.
Never leave a freak behind.
Come on!
It's okay. It's the wolfman. He's in his cage.
No don't!
He was brave.
Are there any left?
You guys are with the Cirque?
Cool... I'm Debbie, this is Sam.
Is the show great? Say yes. We had to sneak out to see it.
You should see the look on your faces.
We could ask you the same thing.
He says now it's like one of those bombed out World War II cathedrals.
Different how?
I think your skin is beautiful.
Can I touch it?
Wow. Has it always been this way?
You shouldn't call him names because he looks different.
What about you, Darren? How are you different?
You mean, how did a girl get up there?
How about you?
But it'd be easier for you than me.
Because chickens have wings.
Let's play mirrors.
I do something and you have to copy me. Like this.
There definitely something different about you. I just can't figure it out.
He's my cousin.
Hold on.
I don't know how you hung on. I couldn't have.
Maybe you need to eat something.
Of course. Evra's doing his snake act tonight.
And you...
I know that. So?
You're such an idiot, Sam.
Hey, Darren.
We're gonna sit on this side.
He was great!
Ours too.
Let's carry him if we have to.
Reacts in horror.
Sam?
Say what happened. Some crazy guy showed up. Sam was in the wrong place at the wrong time.
For the only time in his life.
Do you think we'll meet again?
I hope so...
Cirque is French, right? Are you guys French?
Good one, Darren. Hey. Debbie and Darren. Like Bonnie and Clyde.
Dude, it looks like the kind of suit you'd wear to a funeral.
Hey, we loved the show, man. It was off the hook.
Are you guys on your own? Just traveling. No parents or nothing?
School?
You're the luckiest guys on earth.
You could say you're dermatologically challenged.
Don't worry. She's like a gymnast.
I don't think it'll hold you, dude.
I was hoping for Amanda Bynes.
He's gonna be gone in another day or two. Tonight's the last show.
So stop looking at him like you love him.
Cuz we miss you so much.
Where'd he go?
What are you gonna do?
Go save Debbie, Darren...
I think she loves you...
Blazing in the Cirque campgrounds. The freaks are eating, drinking wine, relaxing after the show. Like a gypsy camp.
Mattress.
It's been too long, Larten.
I suppose. We once shared a coffin together. For six months.
We were being hunted.
A half-vampire?
Nor do we make assistants of children.
A child, Larten? Why?!
And they are?
Self-exiled. And I at least am owed an answer.
And how did you know --
How could a boy find you?
Tiny?
Perhaps you chose the wrong boy.
War.
Well the other side is interested or they wouldn't be trying to get rid of you.
Even so, I'm glad you're alive.
I can still make miles. The war won't wait. And neither will bad news. I have to go.
Would you mind if I walk a bit with your assistant?
You look sick. Doesn't Larten feed you?
Why?
The only thing drinking blood will do to you is keep you alive.
You've already turned, Darren. You need to accept what you've already become. There's no going back.
He was tired of all the killing.
Crepsley was once a Vampire General. One of our great leaders.
I was his assistant. He blooded me, as he blooded you.
To teach me to kill vampaneze. Up until now, it's the only reason he ever chooses anyone.
That's for Crepsley to say. Not me.
Do you know what the biggest danger is to a vampire, Darren?

No. It's that they live so long they no longer care. Everything they love is left behind until they finally have nothing left to live for. Except death. The fact that he's taken an apprentice seems, to me, a good sign. A sign that he's thinking of living not dying.
A clear run. Good.
Stay by him, Darren. Stay by him.
ARRRGGGH!
Darren legs go out and he falls off. As Debbie screams...
Hey, Darren. Hi...
Darren joins Crepsley, a little unsteady.
By my own free will, Darren Shan.
Mr. Tall and Evra watch. Not knowing what to do.
Evra knows it's useless. As he nods, Crepsley turns and strides back toward where he had been.

On the catwalks Murlough draws his knives. Crepsley jumps to the space he wants to defend, draws his own. Murlough counters. Two very serious predators'-at work. The animal kingdom at its killing best.
The audience who haven't left react as the chilling sound reaches them.
Murlough, looming over Debbie, smiles as Darren arrives.
But as Darren stands, it's not over. Steve grabs Debbie, pushes her to the edge where the rafters are.
The audience who remain chanting: "Refund! Refund!" They react as debris falls from above, smashes to the stage.
SCREAMS from the audience as Murlough descends. Somewhere in mid-fall, Crepsley FLITS, disappears. When Murlough hits the center of the stage, he hits it alone. Dead.
